description_en: India's flagship crop insurance scheme providing comprehensive risk cover against crop loss due to natural calamities, pests & diseases. Covers all food and oilseed crops, annual commercial/horticultural crops for which past yield data is available. Premium: Kharif 2%, Rabi 1.5%, Commercial 5% of sum insured.
description_hi: भारत की प्रमुख फसल बीमा योजना जो प्राकृतिक आपदाओं, कीटों और रोगों के कारण फसल हानि के खिलाफ व्यापक जोखिम कवर प्रदान करती है।
coverage: Covers: Prevented sowing, Standing crop losses, Post-harvest losses (up to 14 days), Localized calamities (hailstorm, landslide, inundation), Add-on: Wild animal attack
premium_info: Kharif: 2% of sum insured. Rabi: 1.5% of sum insured. Commercial/Horticultural: 5% of sum insured. Balance premium shared by Central and State Government (50:50).
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas. Both loanee and non-loanee farmers. Sharecroppers and tenant farmers eligible with relevant documents.
how_to_enroll: 1. Through any bank branch (loanee farmers auto-enrolled). 2. Through CSC centers. 3. Online at pmfby.gov.in. 4. Through insurance company or agent. Enrollment must be within cut-off dates.

name_en: Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS)
name_hi: पुनर्गठित मौसम आधारित फसल बीमा योजना
description_en: Weather index-based insurance that uses weather parameters (rainfall, temperature, humidity, wind speed) as proxy for crop yield. Claims triggered automatically when weather parameters deviate from thresholds.
description_hi: मौसम सूचकांक आधारित बीमा जो फसल उपज के लिए प्रॉक्सी के रूप में मौसम मापदंडों का उपयोग करता है।
coverage: Covers adverse weather conditions including: Deficit rainfall, Excess rainfall, Unseasonal rainfall, High temperature, Low temperature, High humidity, High wind speed, Hailstorm, Frost
premium_info: Kharif: 2% of sum insured. Rabi: 1.5% of sum insured. Commercial/Horticultural: 5% of sum insured. Government pays the difference between actuarial premium and farmer premium.
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas where RWBCIS is implemented. Both loanee and non-loanee farmers eligible.
how_to_enroll: Similar to PMFBY - through banks, CSC, online portal, or insurance company agents.

description_en: Insurance cover for coconut palms against natural calamities. Covers damage to palms aged 4 years and above from cyclone, flood, drought, pest & disease attacks.
description_hi: प्राकृतिक आपदाओं के खिलाफ नारियल पाम के लिए बीमा कवर।
coverage: Damage/destruction of coconut palms due to: Natural calamities (cyclone, typhoon, flood, inundation, drought), Pest attacks, Disease attacks. Sum insured: Rs. 900 per palm (healthy bearing), Rs. 600 per palm (not bearing but 4+ years old).
premium_info: Rs. 9 per palm per year for healthy bearing palms. Rs. 6 per palm per year for non-bearing palms. 50% subsidy from Coconut Development Board.
eligibility: Coconut farmers in all states/UTs. Palms must be 4 years or older. Minimum 5 palms for insurance.
how_to_enroll: Apply through Coconut Development Board office, state agriculture department, or participating insurance companies.

description_en: Comprehensive package covering crop insurance, personal accident, dwelling & contents, agricultural pump sets, and student safety for farmer families. One premium for multiple covers.
description_hi: किसान परिवारों के लिए फसल बीमा, व्यक्तिगत दुर्घटना, आवास, कृषि पंप सेट और छात्र सुरक्षा को कवर करने वाला व्यापक पैकेज।
coverage: 1. Crop insurance (PMFBY-linked). 2. Personal accident: Rs. 2 lakh. 3. Dwelling insurance: Rs. 25,000-2 lakh. 4. Agricultural pump set: up to Rs. 50,000. 5. Student safety: Rs. 1 lakh.
premium_info: Varies by components chosen. Approx Rs. 1,000-5,000 per year for comprehensive cover. Government subsidizes 50% of total premium.
eligibility: Farmers in pilot districts. All land-holding farmers with valid bank account. Family members included for personal accident and student safety components.
how_to_enroll: Apply through designated insurance companies in pilot districts. Available through banks and CSCs in select areas.
